txt.en: Deliver the 'medallions' and dwarf-beards to Mézto at Drenghól

Dwarf-beards are kept as trophies by Orcs at Azgh-buzru. Medallions are carried by Orcs, trolls, and goblins loyal to Gorgar the Ruthless at Azgh-buzru.\n\nMézto has asked you to reclaim dwarf-beards taken as trophies by the forces of Gundabad. In addition, Mézto has asked to you collect the crude medallions carried by those loyal to Gorgar the Ruthless.
Mézto can be found at Drenghól in the War of Three Peaks.\n\nYou have collected many trophies from the forces of Gundabad. You should deliver them to Mézto at Drenghól.
After discovering that Gorgar's forces have begun to claim trophies from fallen dwarves, Mézto seeks vengeance on behalf of the Zhélruka of the Gabil'akkâ.

'[placeholder]! What are you doing here? Leave me to my work!'

Mézto takes a crude medallion from a fallen Orc. You notice what appears to be a severed dwarf-beard gripped in his other hand.

'Gorgar is cunning... for an Orc. His slimy ilk have ripped and torn the beards from our fallen kin and kept them as trophies. Trophies! There can be no greater insult!

'If the Lord of the Iron Hills has sent you, I shall not scoff at the prospect of spilling more Orc-blood. Reclaim what they have taken from us, and collect their own 'medallions' in kind. If Gorgar wishes to count the dead, he shall suffer to find scores of his own among them!

'I have been quick to judge you Longbeards. Perhaps too quick. In truth, I see the fury of the Zhélruka in your hearts!

'When our vengeance is done, let us meet in Drenghól. Go!'

'[placeholder]! What are you doing here? Leave me to my work!'

Mézto takes a crude medallion from a fallen Orc. You notice what appears to be a severed dwarf-beard gripped in his other hand.

'Gorgar is cunning... for an Orc. His slimy ilk have ripped and torn the beards from our fallen kin and kept them as trophies. Trophies! There can be no greater insult!

'If the Lord of the Iron Hills has sent you, I shall not scoff at the prospect of spilling more Orc-blood. Reclaim what they have taken from us, and collect their own 'medallions' in kind. If Gorgar wishes to count the dead, he shall suffer to find scores of his own among them!

'You Stout-axes have proven your mettle, and I see the fury of the Zhélruka in your hearts!

'When our vengeance is done, let us meet in Drenghól. Go!'

'Is your vengeance done? May you have found as much joy in it as I did.

'Give me what you have collected and I shall see that all of it is borne to Zarkul-sulûn.

'I shall not forget what you have done for the Zhélruka this day.'

'[placeholder]! What are you doing here? Leave me to my work!'

Mézto takes a crude medallion from a fallen Orc. You notice what appears to be a severed dwarf-beard gripped in his other hand.

'Gorgar is cunning... for an Orc. His slimy ilk have ripped and torn the beards from my fallen kin and kept them as trophies. Trophies! There can be no greater insult!

'If the Lord of the Iron Hills has sent you, I shall not scoff at the prospect of spilling more Orc-blood. Reclaim what they have taken from us, and collect their own 'medallions' in kind. If Gorgar wishes to count the dead, he shall suffer to find scores of his own among them!

'Say what you will of the Longbeards and these Stout-axes, I see the fury of the Zhélruka in their hearts! Is it in yours as well?

'When our vengeance is done, let us meet in Drenghól. Go!'
